content: cell phone holder by suzy edukaitis hi everyone this is a super simple no sew project perfect for beginners and very useful it is a basic pattern so you can change the colors however you want and if it s not the right size try a bigger hook if it is too small or smaller hook if it is too big you can use different yarn to alter it i have included my final measurements so you can compare the way yours is coming out to what i did as far as yarn i held 2 strands of 4ply weight yarn so it was thick and sturdy to support the weight of a cell phone or a tv remote thin yarn has no body to it materials hook size h i used 2 strands of 4 ply held together to make it stiff and sturdy thin yarns will not hold the phone up stitches used chain slip_stitch single_crochet measurements approx base 3 x 3 the back of the stand on mine is 3 high start from the base chain 13 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each remaining chain chain 1 turn 12 single_crochet row 2 12 single_crochet in each st across ch1 turn 12 sts when starting the sides i did the 1st row in the same color as the base so you would not see the sts they would just blend in also i like my things to be different so in the picture i used a pattern for hearts and another i did tulips these patterns are not included here since they are not mine to share but a simple search will get you patterns for all kinds of things you can add in like a row of cupcakes very cute i added mine in after a couple of row of the sides were done round 13 work 1 single_crochet in each st and end of row with ch2 in the corners slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet 48 sts 8 chs chain 1 turn round 14 work 1 single_crochet blo in each st around skipping the 2 chs in the corners chain 1 turn 48 sts the blo will create a bend in the stitches to form the sides row 15 single_crochet in next 36 sts this creates the 3 sides leave the remaining 12 sts unworked this is the front opening 36 sts row 17 single_crochet decrease in 1st 2 sts single_crochet around to last 2 sts decrease ch1 turn 34 sts row 18 24 repeat row 17 you should now have 20 st ch1 f o weave in ends the tulip pattern is not mine but can easily be found on the internet along with many other ideas to add
